creator: @next

content:
Depends on what you are looking for as to what answer is given. What is your definition of a template?

I see the native templates as basically useless except as a source of boiler plate text.

The mail merge addon offers the features of merging data from address books or CSV files into individual emails a very handy tool in it's own right. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/mail-merge/

Then there is the smart templates https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/smarttemplate4/ This is probably what you are looking for.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help you.


Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges, and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox.


If you have a pop account, check the recycle bin to see if it is empty. Even if you can do it, compressing is sometimes helpful, but also the "Repair folder" via your right mouse button on the Inbox.(properties).

If you have an imap account, it may be that you have reached the maximum storage capacity of your provider, then cleaning up is highly desirable.


Greetings firefox volunteer.
creator: googlethunderbird

content: Pop3 permette di scaricare solo la posta ricevuta. Per sincronizzare sia la posta ricevuta che quella inviata devi usare Imap. Qui è spiegata la differenza tra i due protocolli https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/differenze-imap-pop3

content:
I am not a customer of Proton, I have never seen their sopftware but I have read a little about how their supposed encryption works. My feeling is it does not work for email at all. But personal views aside, point 2 of the steps Proton list for installing into Thunderbird are Enter your name, email address, and Proton Mail Bridge password. I assume you have not done that as you claim not to know what it is. Perhaps you need to ask the folk at proton.

I did look at the install instructions for the bridge software and point 2 in that indicates the password to use for the account is displayed when you add the account to the bridge. https://proton.me/support/protonmail-bridge-install

content: That is because they are different addressbooks. If you want to use the Gmail addressbook, you can add it as a Carddav addressbook at the 'new addressbook' menu item.
creator: davidsk

content: I don't think you need TBird in this case. I did a bit of digging and found this article from iinet https://help.iinet.net.au/iinet-email-messaging-company Long story short, the entirety of your iinet account is going to migrate to the Messaging Company and as long as you follow the steps in the link above you shouldn't lose any data. Afterwards, if you still wish to use TBird then it's as simple as signing in with your usual email and password. Let me know if that answers your question and also if you continue to need help but remember you need to migrate your account first because TBird isn't a domain but a client.
creator: harrisonstew

content: Here is what I did, I went to my windows antivirus (windows security) and added an exclusion. C:\Documents and Settings\(Windows User name)\Application Data\Thunderbird\Profiles\. My concern is: Am I vulnerable to getting virus from Thunderbird?
